result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Michael Matz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentences now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: TO BE PAID IN FULL BY THE END OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  PAY ON A MONTHLY PAYMENT PLAN THROUGH HIS AGENT.  Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Pay the cost of supervision.  AMENDED 2/16/15.  COURT APPOINTED ATTORNEY FEES ADDED.  TO BE PAID THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Seek and maintain full-time employment.  Defendant must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your agent.  Complete HSED or GED.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the American Legion Post 541 or any members of that post.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: same as prison sentence.

records.addlTxt: Sent ORGA with attached bill to Judge

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Betthauser. Victim notification has been complied with, per State.   State recommended:  6 years initial confinement,  5 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with each other.  Consecutive to  14CF128.  Attorney Betthauser requests sentence be concurrent to each other, and his Eau Claire County Case.  Consecutive to 14CF128.   Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  15CF69.  6 years initial confinement,  5 years extended supervision.  15CF71:  6 years initial confinement,  5 years extended supervision.  Concurrent to each other.  Consecutive to all other sentences currently serving.  CC.  Restitution.  Rustic Haven:  $2000.00.  Am Legion $375.00.  Complete HSED or GED.  Obtain and maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.  Set up payment plan, pay monthly toward restitution.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Pay costs of supervision.  No contact with the owner of Rustic Haven or his family.  No contact American Legion Post 451, legion member or Mr. N.  Eligible for CIP or SAP.
Sentencing hearing at 02-08-2016 01:30 pm

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Betthauser.   Victim notification requirement met.  Defense wishes to proceed with plea/sentencing today.  State does not want sentencing today without a PSI report.  Court only accepting a plea today.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court advised the defendant of the possible penalties of the charge he is pleading to. He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. He understood.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of count 1.  PSI ordered due 1/28/16 .   SEH set for  2/8/16 at 1:30 pm.  Remanded.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-04-2015 01:30 pm
Copies of VIS & restitution worksheet sent to Judge
